thread.title: Debate: Sanders says people 'tired' of Clinton email controversy
thread.title_full: Debate: Sanders says people 'tired' of Clinton email controversy

title: Debate: Sanders says people 'tired' of Clinton email controversy
text:
Debate: Sanders says people 'tired' of Clinton email controversy 
Updated: Wed, Oct 14 2015, 04:01 PM 
By: Sinclair Broadcast Group LAS VEGAS -- It was the question that everyone saw coming.Hillary Clinton, when asked about her future hearing that will address her use of a private email server as the former Secretary of State, said "I've taken responsibility for it. I did say it was a mistake."Clinton said it wasn't the best choice, "I have been as transparent as I know to be" noting the release of 55 thousand pages of emails from the server.But it was the reaction of fellow presidential hopeful Sen. Bernie Sanders that made for a moment of unity between the two candidates."The American people are sick and tired of hearing about the... emails" he said, as Clinton agreed."Thank you" she said, "Me too. Me too."Defending her position, Clinton noted recent statements made by House Republican Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy , on the creation of the House select committee investigating the 2012 attacks on American government outposts in Benghazi."Let's just take a minute here and point out that this committee is basically an arm of the Republican National Committee" she said to an applauding audience.Clinton, reiterating the committee was meant to "drive down my poll numbers." "[Benghazi] committee is basically an arm of the RNC—I intend to keep talking about the issues that matter to the American people." -Hillary — Hillary Clinton (@HillaryClinton) October 14, 2015 
"Big surprise. And that is what they have attempted to do."Already Sanders' campaign team has emailed the moment, asking for more support in his quest for the White House. Bernie Sanders' campaign is fundraising off his Clinton emails line tonight http://t.co/FgJZwuMHSK #DemDebate pic.twitter.com/ECtGkjY0Hl — Financial Times (@FT) October 14, 2015 
People offered these responses on social media: Bernie Sanders is genuine, honest, and funny. Politics aside, he's hard not to like. http://t.co/oF0rHhqWjm — Evan Osherow (@EvanOsherow) October 14, 2015 U Bernie fans feel the Bern being sold down the river? Sold u out by falling all over himself 2 remove Hills email scandal #DebateWithBernie
